page.title: 18BROADFORD HOTEL page2
page.content: {Continued from page 17..............} The hotel is open for the "season" from April to October.It has been in the Campbell family since 1933. The hotel was established as an inn for travellers by Sir Lachlan Mackinnon in 1611 and it was here that Prince Charles Edward Stuart presented to the Mackinnons of Skye the recipe of his own personal liqueur the{'dram buidhe'-Drambuie}the recipe of which remains secret to this day. Much of the original building still remains with its crow stepped gables which are characteristic of Scottish Architecture.
